rawMetadata: {"compiler":{"version":"0.8.10+commit.fc410830"},"language":"Solidity","output":{"abi":[],"devdoc":{"author":"Compound","kind":"dev","methods":{},"title":"Exponential module for storing fixed-precision decimals","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"notice":"Exp is a struct which stores decimals with a fixed precision of 18 decimal places. @dev Truncates the given exp to a whole number value.
      For example, truncate(Exp{mantissa: 15 * expScale}) = 15

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct ExponentialNoError.Exp memory,uint256) pure returns (struct ExponentialNoError.Exp memory)

documentation.text: @dev Multiply an Exp by a scalar, then truncate to return an unsigned integer.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct ExponentialNoError.Exp memory,uint256) pure returns (struct ExponentialNoError.Exp memory)

documentation.text: @dev Multiply an Exp by a scalar, truncate, then add an to an unsigned integer, returning an unsigned integer.
@dev Checks if first Exp is less than second Exp.
@dev Checks if left Exp <= right Exp.
@dev Checks if left Exp > right Exp.
@dev returns true if Exp is exactly zero
